Sentencas: Strontium-doped lanthanum cobalt ferrite (LSCF) is a widely used cathode material due to its high electronic and ionic conductivity, and reasonable oxygen surface exchange coefficient.
Titulo: Effect of Sr Content and Strain on Sr Surface Segregation of La1-xSrxCo0.2Fe0.8O3-δ as Cathode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, LSCF can have long-term stability issues such as surface segregation of Sr during solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) operation, which can adversely affect the electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Effect of Sr Content and Strain on Sr Surface Segregation of La1-xSrxCo0.2Fe0.8O3-δ as Cathode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Thus, understanding the nature Of the Sr surface segregation phenomenon and how it is affected by the composition of LSCF and strain are critical.
Titulo: Effect of Sr Content and Strain on Sr Surface Segregation of La1-xSrxCo0.2Fe0.8O3-δ as Cathode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In this research, heteroepitaxial thin films of La1-xSrxCo0.2Fe0.8O3-delta with varying Sr content (x = 0.4, 0.3, 0.2) were deposited by pulsed laser deposition (PLD) on single-crystal NdGaO3, SrTiO3, and GdScO3 substrates, leading to different levels of strain in the films.
Titulo: Effect of Sr Content and Strain on Sr Surface Segregation of La1-xSrxCo0.2Fe0.8O3-δ as Cathode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The extent of Sr segregation at the film surface was quantified using synchrotron-based total-reflection X-ray fluorescence (TXRF) and atomic force microscopy (AFM).
Titulo: Effect of Sr Content and Strain on Sr Surface Segregation of La1-xSrxCo0.2Fe0.8O3-δ as Cathode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The electronic structure of the Sr-rich phases formed on the surface was investigated by hard X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (HAXPES).
Titulo: Effect of Sr Content and Strain on Sr Surface Segregation of La1-xSrxCo0.2Fe0.8O3-δ as Cathode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The extent of Sr segregation was found to be a function of the Sr content in bulk.
Titulo: Effect of Sr Content and Strain on Sr Surface Segregation of La1-xSrxCo0.2Fe0.8O3-δ as Cathode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Lowering the Sr content from 40% to 30% reduced the surface segregation, but further lowering the Sr content to 20% increased the segregation.
Titulo: Effect of Sr Content and Strain on Sr Surface Segregation of La1-xSrxCo0.2Fe0.8O3-δ as Cathode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The strain of LSCF thin films on various substrates was measured using high-resolution X-ray diffraction (HRXRD), and the Sr surface segregation was found to be reduced with compressive strain and enhanced with tensile strain present within the thin films.
Titulo: Effect of Sr Content and Strain on Sr Surface Segregation of La1-xSrxCo0.2Fe0.8O3-δ as Cathode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: A model was developed correlating the Sr surface segregation with Sr content and strain effects to explain the experimental results.
Titulo: Effect of Sr Content and Strain on Sr Surface Segregation of La1-xSrxCo0.2Fe0.8O3-δ as Cathode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
